3.japanese: もう 昨日も 今日もゴロゴロして
3.english: Lazing around all day yesterday and today.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: え～ 昨日はゴロゴロじゃなくて
4.english: What? Yesterday I was laying around, not lazing around. {\a6}Even though we're small

5.speaker: COMMERCIAL
5.japanese: お世話になった あの方へ!
5.english: To the people we need to thank

8.speaker: COMMERCIAL
8.japanese: 心を込めて クリスマスプレゼント!

9.speaker: SONG
9.japanese: 心を込めて クリスマスプレゼント!
9.english: {\a6}Drum with our feet ...from the bottom of our hearts! Yama Arashi are so cool.

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: お母さん お世話された僕にちょうだい プレゼント
11.english: Mom, I've been so nice to youthat you should get me a present. All you do is clean, after all. Don't suck me up!

12.speaker: MEIMEI
12.japanese: やっぱりプレゼント贈らないとね
12.english: I really do need to get a present. What? What are you going to get me? It's not for {\i1}you{\i0}. It's for Prince Han. I wonder what I should get.

13.speaker: PANDA
13.japanese: 半田さんならブラシでしょ
13.english: If it's for Mr. Handa, you should get him a brush.

15.speaker: PANDA
15.japanese: 半田さん お風呂掃除が好きだから
15.english: Mr. Handa really likes to clean his bathroom,

16.speaker: PANDA
16.japanese: 掃除するたびに思い出してもらえるよ
16.english: so he'll remember you every time he uses it.

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: 半田さん お風呂が１０個ある家に住むのが夢だって
18.english: Mr. Handa said that his dream is to live in a house with ten bathtubs.

19.speaker: MEIMEI
19.english: What? Really? Does he really want to clean that much?

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: なんか そんなイメージ
20.english: At least that's how I imagine him.

21.speaker: MEIMEI
21.japanese: 一瞬でも信じて損した
21.english: I was an idiot to believe you even for a second.

22.speaker: MEIMEI
22.japanese: やっぱり私の写真にしよ
22.english: I think I'll just give him my picture.

23.speaker: MEIMEI
23.japanese: これで いつでも一緒!
23.english: That way we'll always be together.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: え～ いらないんじゃないかな?
24.english: What? I don't think he'll want that.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.english: You should give him my picture. My picture is better!

27.speaker: MEIMEI
27.japanese: きっと かわいいって言ってくれるもん!
27.english: He'll totally say I'm cute! Bleh!

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: 僕のほうがかわいいって言うよ!

30.speaker: PANDA MAMA
30.japanese: ケンカするくらいならお母さんの写真をおくっておきなさい!
30.english: If you're going to fight about it, just send him a picture of me.

31.speaker: BOTH
31.japanese: え～!お母さんはかわいくないよ
31.english: What? But you're not cute, Mom. Don't suck me up! I wonder if there's anyone who'll give me a present. Like maybe a new panda pochette.

32.speaker: PANDA
32.japanese: モコモコの手編みとかいいな
32.english: I'd like a fluffy, hand-knitted one. Hello!

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: あれ? シロクマくん
35.english: Huh? I've never seen you dress like that, Polar Bear.

36.speaker: POLAR BEAR
36.japanese: クリスマス向けに 衣装替えしたんだよ
36.english: I mixed things up for Christmas.

37.speaker: PANDA
37.english: So cool! I wonder if I'll look cooler if I get a new pochette. You're wonderful, Mr. Panda!

38.speaker: GIRL2
38.japanese: かっこよくて かわいい!

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.japanese: ポシェットにそこまでの力はないでしょ
40.english: I don't think a pochette wields that much power. Well, if it isn't Panda.

41.speaker: PANDA
41.japanese: あれ? きれいなラマさん?

43.speaker: ALPACA
43.japanese: どうも はじめまして アルパカです
43.english: Hello, nice to meet you. My name is Alpaca.

45.speaker: ALPACA
45.japanese: クリスマスの準備です

47.speaker: LLAMA
47.japanese: 毎年 クリスマスには
47.english: Every year for Christmas, Mr. Alpaca and I use our wool to make hand-knitted items.

48.speaker: ALPACA
48.japanese: 贈り先がたくさんあるので焦ってます
48.english: We have to send them to many places so we're a little panicked.

50.speaker: ALPACA
50.japanese: フェルトとか 毛糸とか
50.english: Our yarn and our felt is quite popular every year.

51.speaker: LLAMA
51.japanese: 毎年 皆さんには心配されるんですけど
51.english: Everyone worries when they see us without our coats every year. Oh, so when you lost all that weight, it was just because your coat was gone. Yes. We make yarn with it and dye it,

52.english: so it's a lot of work...

53.speaker: ALPACA
53.japanese: 喜んでもらえるから 毎年頑張れるんです
53.english: It makes everyone happy, so that keeps us going year after year.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: アルパカウールで パンダポシェットも作ってくれないかな
55.english: Could you make a panda pochette with alpaca wool?

56.speaker: LLAMA
56.japanese: えっ ラマウールじゃないんですか?

57.speaker: PANDA
57.japanese: だって アルパカウールのほうが高級っぽいもん
57.english: Well, alpaca wool seems more luxurious. So, how are you going to spend your Christmas, Miss Sasako? We'll be serving a special  Christmas dinner.

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.english: It's a great time to make a profit. Cha-ching!

59.speaker: SASAKO
59.japanese: そんな 身も蓋もない言い方しないでください…
59.english: Could you not put it so bluntly like that? What are you personallygoing to do for Christmas?

60.speaker: SASAKO
60.japanese: 接客と洗い物ですかね
60.english: I'll be serving customers and washing dishes.

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: いや だから 仕事のあと

63.speaker: PENGUIN
63.japanese: もうちょっとあるでしょ?

64.english: Like in between work and going home?

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.english: Yeah, that. I have to stop at the grocery store and buy some thick Aegean Sea yogurt.

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.japanese: クリスマスにヨーグルトって どんだけ好きなの…
67.english: Really? Yogurt for Christmas? Exactly how much do you like that stuff?

68.speaker: SASAKO
68.japanese: おいしいですよ オススメです
68.english: It's delicious. I highly recommend it.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: おいしいとかの問題じゃないでしょ!
69.english: It's not the matter of it being delicious or not!

70.speaker: PENGUIN
70.japanese: みんな クリスマスについて考えなさすぎ!
70.english: None of you are putting enough thought into Christmas!

71.speaker: PANDA
71.japanese: ペンギンさんは何考えてるの?
71.english: What did you have in mind, Mr. Penguin?

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: クリスマスみたいな季節行事はね
72.english: You have to handle seasonal events like Christmas properly.

73.speaker: PENGUIN
73.japanese: クリスマスツリーを飾って
73.english: Like putting up a Christmas tree,

74.english: eating cake, and exchanging presents. That's what Christmas is all about.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.english: I have enough for everyone, too.

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: みんなで集まって パーティーわいわい楽しもうよ
77.english: Let's all get together, throw a party, and have fun!

78.speaker: POLAR BEAR
78.japanese: みんなで わいわい?

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.english: Yeah. Maybe you should get on a crowded train, then. That's not it.

80.speaker: POLAR BEAR
80.japanese: スクランブル交差点を渡るのは?
80.english: How about crossing a huge intersection?

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: そういう集まりじゃなくて
82.english: I don't mean getting together like that.

83.japanese: もっと 楽しいわいわいだよ
83.english: I mean something a little more fun {\i1}(wai wai){\i0}. Oh, you mean like a festival.

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: それは ワッショイ 違うったら
84.english: No, that would be heave-ho {\i1}(wasshoi){\i0}. That's not it!

85.speaker: PENGUIN
85.japanese: だから パーティー!
85.english: I'm saying we should have a party!

86.speaker: PENGUIN
86.japanese: お店終わってからでいいから
86.english: It can even be after you close up the shop. You'll come right, Panda?

87.speaker: PENGUIN
87.japanese: 僕の落語を披露するよ
87.english: I'll even do some of my traditional comedic story-telling.

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: ギリギリに返事するのでもいい?
88.english: Could I answer at the absolute last minute?

89.speaker: PENGUIN
89.japanese: なんだったら 今やるよ
89.english: Or I could do that right now.

90.speaker: PENGUIN
90.japanese: え～ まいどバカバカしい小話をひとつ
90.english: Well, let's start off with a slightly idiotic tale.

91.speaker: PENGUIN
91.japanese: 今年も寒くなってまいりました
91.english: It's starting to get chilly again this year. And now for our next speaker.

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.japanese: ラマさんとアルパカさんは どうするの?
94.english: What are you two going to do, Mr. Llama and Mr. Alpaca?

96.speaker: LLAMA
96.japanese: すみません 僕ら毎年ミサに行くんですよ
96.english: I'm sorry, but we go to mass each year.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.english: You guys are really traditional, huh? Hello. I came to deliver your Christmas wreath. Oh, it's so pretty!

98.speaker: SASAKO
98.japanese: リンリンさん さすがですね

99.speaker: RINRIN
99.japanese: いえいえ それほどでもあります

100.speaker: RINRIN
100.japanese: パンダくんが僕のリースを見てくれると思うと
100.english: I got all excited thinking about Panda seeing my wreath.

103.speaker: RINRIN
103.english: Speaking of Christmas, I've already ordered my cake.

104.speaker: RINRIN
104.japanese: パンダの形のパンダケーキです
104.english: It's a cake in the shape of a panda. So your cake is a panda, as well?

105.speaker: RINRIN
105.japanese: それだけじゃないですよ
105.english: That's not all! My Christmas cards are also panda shaped.

106.speaker: RINRIN
106.english: Not to mention a panda tree, and a panda Santa.

107.speaker: RINRIN
107.japanese: 来年に備えてパンダカレンダー パンダ年賀状
107.english: And in preparation for next year, a panda calender, panda New Year's cards, a panda decorative pine tree,

108.speaker: RINRIN
108.english: panda New Year's food, and panda New Year's soup!

109.speaker: PENGUIN
109.english: Wow, that's amazing. I wasn't aware that the world was filled with that many panda goods. You didn't mention any panda lights!

110.speaker: RINRIN
110.japanese: あっ! パンダくんも来てたの!?
110.english: Oh, I didn't know you were here, Panda!

112.speaker: RINRIN
112.japanese: あのね あのね パンダくんに
112.english: So... I'll be sending you a Christmas present, Panda!

113.speaker: PANDA
113.japanese: 別に いらないですよ…

115.speaker: RINRIN
115.japanese: ネットで見つけた木彫りパンダとか どう?
115.english: How about the panda  wood carving I found online? I don't really want it.

116.speaker: RINRIN
116.japanese: パンダマトリョーシカが いいかな?
116.english: How about a panda matryoshka doll?

117.speaker: PANDA
117.japanese: もう 持ってるもん

118.speaker: RINRIN
118.japanese: パンダくん抱き枕とか!
118.english: How about a panda hug pillow?

119.speaker: PANDA
119.japanese: そんなの使わないやい!
119.english: I won't use something like that! I wonder what you'd like.

120.speaker: PANDA
120.japanese: だから いらないってば!
120.english: I told you, I don't want anything!

121.speaker: PANDA
121.japanese: リンリンに 僕の欲しいものなんかわかんないやい!
121.english: Rin Rin would never figure out what I want! Our tastes are completely different. The thing I want most right now is a panda pochette!

122.speaker: RINRIN
122.japanese: じゃあ クリスマスまでに考えておくね
122.english: Then I'll think about it until Christmas.

123.speaker: RINRIN
123.japanese: な～んて ほんとは もう決めてあるんだけど
123.english: Just kidding. I already know what I'm going to give you.

124.speaker: RINRIN
124.japanese: ひと針 ひと針 心を込めて

126.speaker: RINRIN
126.japanese: 手編みの パンダポーチ!

127.speaker: RINRIN
127.japanese: ポシェットにもできて
127.english: You can even use it as a pochette, and we'll be matching.

128.speaker: RINRIN
128.japanese: パンダくん気に入ってくれるかな
128.english: I hope Panda will like it!

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.japanese: 僕に何か言い忘れてない?
132.english: Didn't you forget to say something to me?

134.japanese: パーティーとか誘わなくて大丈夫?
134.english: you don't need to invite me to a party or something? I'm sure.

139.speaker: PENGUIN
139.japanese: 明日がクリスマス・イブだっていうのに
139.english: Tomorrow's Christmas Eve, but no one's invited me to a party.

140.speaker: PENGUIN
140.japanese: せっかく 落語の練習したのに…
140.english: And I've been practicing my traditional comedic story-telling, too.

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.english: Mr. Penguin. If you're free, do you want to stop by Grizzly's Bar for a bit?

142.speaker: OTTER
142.japanese: いらっしゃいませ こんばんはでやんす

143.speaker: PENGUIN
143.japanese: あれ? グリズリーくんは?

144.speaker: OTTER
144.japanese: 冬の間は グリズリーさんに頼まれて

145.speaker: OTTER
145.japanese: お店を 手伝ってるんでやんすよ
145.english: Mr. Grizzly asks me to help out at the bar.

147.speaker: POLAR BEAR
147.japanese: ペンギンさん 明日予定ないならさ…
147.english: Mr. Penguin, if you're free tomorrow... Huh? What? Are you having a party?

148.speaker: POLAR BEAR
148.japanese: 大掃除でも したら?
148.english: Why don't you do some major cleaning?

150.japanese: そんな生活感のあるイベント!
150.english: There's no way I'd do something so productive!

151.speaker: OTTER
151.japanese: あの～ ペンギンさん
151.english: Pardon me, Mr. Penguin, are you free tomorrow?

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.english: Ooh, are you having a party? No... I was wondering if you'd take my shift tomorrow night.

153.speaker: PENGUIN
153.japanese: なんで バイトのシフトに組み込まれなくちゃならないの?
153.english: Why am I being asked to work a part-time shift?

154.speaker: OTTER
154.japanese: どうしよう 彼女とのデート…
154.english: What am I going to do? I have a date with my girlfriend...

155.speaker: POLAR BEAR
155.japanese: それなら 彼女にグリズリーバーに来てもらえばいいじゃない
155.english: Then why don't you have her come down to Grizzly's Bar?

156.speaker: POLAR BEAR
156.english: You could have some drinks together.

158.speaker: OTTER
158.japanese: もっと プライベートな時間を過ごしたいでやんすよ!
158.english: I'd like to spend some time alone with her.

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: どうしよう? シロクマくん
159.english: What am I going to do, Polar Bear?

160.speaker: PENGUIN
160.japanese: このままだと せっかくの落語を披露する場所がないよ
160.english: At this rate, I won't be able to present my traditional comedic story-telling anywhere. I think that may be okay in its own way.

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: カワウソくん お勘定

163.speaker: GRANPA
163.japanese: 日めくり更新 本日祝日
163.english: Daily pad calender renewal. Today is a holiday.

166.speaker: PENGUIN
166.japanese: とうとう今日になっちゃったよ
166.english: Today is finally the day... What do you mean?

170.speaker: PANDA
170.english: We can't let our guard down.

171.speaker: PENGUIN
171.english: What do you mean? There's no telling when or who I'll be getting presents from today.

172.speaker: PENGUIN
172.japanese: キミ ほんと幸せだね…
172.english: You must lead a very happy life.

173.speaker: POLAR BEAR
173.english: Now, now. I didn't order this.

174.speaker: POLAR BEAR
174.japanese: クリスマスプレゼントだよ
174.english: It's a Christmas present. Really? Thank you.

175.speaker: PENGUIN
175.japanese: あ~でも シロクマくんから
175.english: Oh... But since we weren't expecting a gift from you, we didn't bring anything in return, right, Panda?

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: 僕のかわいさでお返しするよ フフッ
176.english: I'll repay you with my cuteness.

177.speaker: PENGUIN
177.japanese: じゃあ もう それでいいことにしよう

179.speaker: POLAR BEAR
179.japanese: プレゼントは気持を贈るものだから
179.english: It's the thought that counts. You're so cool, Polar Bear.

181.speaker: GRIZZLY
181.japanese: 冬眠中って書いてあるだろ!!
181.english: It says right here that I'm hibernating, doesn't it?!

182.speaker: GUY
182.japanese: お お お お荷物です…
182.english: I-I-I have a package for you...

184.speaker: GRIZZLY
184.japanese: また シロクマのイタズラかと思ったぜ
184.english: I thought Polar Bear was messing around again.

185.speaker: GRIZZLY
185.english: Thank ya. I'll be going now.

186.speaker: POLAR BEAR
186.japanese: はい しろくまカフェで…
186.english: Hello. This is Polar Bear's Ca—

187.speaker: GRIZZLY
187.english: What the hell are you trying to do, you bastard?!

188.speaker: GRIZZLY
188.japanese: 俺は冬眠するって言ってあるだろ!
188.english: I told you I'd be hibernating!

189.speaker: GRIZZLY
189.japanese: だいたい なんだサラダ油って!
189.english: Not to mention, why the hell did you send me vegetable oil?!

191.speaker: POLAR BEAR
191.japanese: まあまあ 成功かな?
191.english: I think that was somewhat a success.

192.speaker: PENGUIN
192.japanese: それ どういう意味で?
192.english: How do you figure? Oh, that's right. There's a gift for you, Panda.

194.speaker: PANDA
194.english: Bamboo grass? Bamboo shoots? A panda pochette! It's so fluffy!

195.speaker: PANDA
195.japanese: 笹子さん ありがとう
195.english: Thank you so much, Miss Sasako!

198.speaker: RINRIN
198.japanese: 気に入ってくれると思ってた!

199.speaker: PANDA
199.japanese: こ これ… リンリンのプレゼント?
199.english: Th-This is from you, Rin Rin?

202.speaker: RINRIN
202.japanese: パンダくんに 絶対 似合うよ
202.english: It'll look great on you, Panda!

203.speaker: PANDA
203.japanese: あ 当たり前でしょ!

204.japanese: 似合わないわけないよ!

205.speaker: BABY EMPEROR
205.japanese: 次は 終点 終点
205.english: Next stop, the end of the line. End of the line.

206.speaker: BABY EMPEROR
206.japanese: お忘れ物のないようにお気をつけください
206.english: Please be sure to take all of your belongings with you.

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: 笹子さん 笹子さん

212.speaker: PENGUIN
212.japanese: ほんとにヨーグルト買って 家帰るだけ?
212.english: Are you really just buying yogurt and heading home?

213.speaker: SASAKO
213.japanese: そうですよ? じゃあ また明日

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.japanese: シロクマくん 飲みにいかない?
214.english: Do you want to go out for a drink, Polar Bear?

215.speaker: POLAR BEAR
215.japanese: ごめん ちょっと予定あるから

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.japanese: 予定があるって これのこと?
219.english: So this is what you meant by plans?

220.speaker: POLAR BEAR
220.english: Yup. Part-time job. Could it be that you took the shift for Otter?

222.speaker: POLAR BEAR
222.japanese: いやぁ… シェーカーを振ってみたかっただけだよ
222.english: Nah. I just wanted to use a shaker. So cool.

223.speaker: LION
223.japanese: シロクマさん おかわり
223.english: Mr. Polar Bear, could I get another?

225.speaker: POLAR BEAR
225.japanese: 今日は お一人ですか?

226.speaker: LION
226.japanese: うん トラは家族サービス
226.english: Yeah. Tiger is with his family and Wolf has his part-time job.

229.speaker: ADELIE
229.japanese: クリスマス商戦は 敗退しました
229.english: We have lost the Christmas sales battle.

230.speaker: GENTOO
230.english: Why?! Penguin cards are the perfect Christmas gift.

232.speaker: CHINSTRAP
232.japanese: 泣くなよ 世の中には
232.english: Don't cry. There are just too many people in the world that just don't understand.

234.speaker: ADELIE
234.japanese: ２組セットで 片方は赤 片方は緑
234.english: There are two sets packaged together. One red, one green.

235.speaker: ADELIE
235.japanese: ラッピングも クリスマス仕様にしたのに
235.english: We even wrapped them to fit the season.

236.speaker: GENTOO
236.japanese: それに こんなに用意したのに
236.english: We prepared so well, and yet...

237.speaker: GENTOO
237.english: We now have a mountain of returned goods!

238.speaker: CHINSTrAP
238.japanese: クリスマスパーティーで
238.english: I was hoping people would enjoy playing with them at Christmas parties.

239.speaker: PENGUIN
239.japanese: そんなこといったらさ
239.english: You're not the only ones bummed out.

240.japanese: 僕だって 落語 披露したかったよ
240.english: I wanted to present my traditional comedic story-telling.

241.speaker: PENGUIN
241.japanese: いつ むぅ なな…
241.english: Five, six, seven... How many herrings were in that soba? There were four.

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.japanese: いつ むぅ なな や～ ここのつ

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.japanese: おあとが よろしいようで
243.english: And that's it for me. Thank you!

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.japanese: 最後まで話せたのは初めてだよ!
244.english: That's the first time I was able to finish the whole thing!

245.speaker: ADELIE
245.japanese: いえいえ よかったですよ

246.speaker: PENGUIN
246.japanese: あぁ カード１つちょうだいよ
246.english: Let me get a set of those cards.

249.speaker: PENGUINS
249.japanese: ありがとうございます!

250.speaker: LION
250.english: I'll take a set, too. Thank you very much.

252.japanese: 落語 アンコールだ

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.japanese: えぇ!? ありがとうございます

254.speaker: POLAR BEAR
254.japanese: シャンパン 開けちゃった
254.english: I opened up a bottle of champagne.

257.speaker: WOLF
257.japanese: あ～ やってた よかった
257.english: Oh good. You're all still here.

258.speaker: LION
258.japanese: お～ オオカミ よく来たな
258.english: Hey, Wolf. Glad you could make it.

260.japanese: お店のやつ １個もらってきた
260.english: I got one from the shop.

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: もうパン屋なんだか、オオカミなんだか、サンタなんだかわかんないよね
261.english: It's hard to tell if you're a baker, a wolf, or Santa.

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: キミが それを言うの?
262.english: Really? You're gonna be the one to bring that up?

264.speaker: POLAR BEAR
264.english: I'll cut it into seven pieces.

265.speaker: RINRIN
265.english: Good evening. Eight pieces it is.

266.speaker: MAMA
266.japanese: ちょっと 食べるときくらい
266.english: Come on now. You need to take off the pochette when you're eating at least. Isn't it great?

267.speaker: MAMA
267.japanese: もう…クリスマスだから 特別よ
267.english: Goodness. I'll make an exception because it's Christmas.

268.speaker: MEIMEI
268.japanese: 私のプレゼントも喜んでくれるかなぁ
268.english: I wonder if he'll like my present, too.

269.speaker: OTTERKO
269.english: That was delicious. It'll be great if we can go again next year and the year after that, too.

271.speaker: HANDA
271.english: Prince Han? This is the first time I've had such a fun Christmas!

272.speaker: GENTOO
272.japanese: アデリーカード きた～!
272.english: Totally got the Adélie penguin card!

273.speaker: LION
273.japanese: シャンパン もう１本 開けよう!もう１本
273.english: Let's open another champagne! One more!

274.speaker: POLAR BEAR
274.japanese: じゃあ とっておきのやつ いこう
274.english: Then let's open an extra special one.

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.japanese: こっちにもちょうだい

278.speaker: RINRIN
278.japanese: あ 僕も いいですか?
278.english: Could I have some, as well?

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
279.japanese: じゃあ 乾杯しようか

282.speaker: GENTOO
282.japanese: ありがとうございます

285.speaker: SASAKO
285.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

287.english: What is it, Miss Sasako? Please don't mind me and continue talking.

288.speaker: PANDA
288.japanese: ねえ ペンギンさん
288.english: Hey, Mr. Penguin. Don't you get a delicious taste in your mouth when you say "Panda"?

291.speaker: PENGUIN
291.english: I don't think you really needed to try it out.

292.speaker: PENGUIN
292.japanese: めんどくさい人増えちゃったな

293.speaker: PENGUIN
293.japanese: シロクマ君 終わろう

294.speaker: POLAR BEAR
294.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェには

295.speaker: POLAR BEAR
295.japanese: 七つの間違いがあります
295.english: will have seven mistakes. What are they?

296.speaker: PENGUIN
296.english: There won't be any, so please don't look for them.
